title: Are there any cheap Laptops that can run LoL?
body:
Hi everyone, 

I'm looking for a cheap laptop that can run LoL . I was wondering what would be the minimum requirements to look for.
Any help will be appreciated. Thank you.

Ana

replies.body:
Personal reccomendation: i7 processor (I think mine is the 770k?) doesnt have to be top tier because there are some very good mid tier i7's, 8 gb ram because 4 is honestly very low, and there are plenty of great cheap graphics cards ( im using the nvidia 780 TI which is now an outdated model).


However as long as you meet the minimum specs Porocles provided your main concern should be your internet. A great computer with crappy internet is no better than a crappy computer with crappy internet, I highly reccomend using a LAN cable for playing games online because its faster and more stable than wifi.

Also I would reccomend against a laptop and getting a desktop. You can get pimped out desktops for cheaper than above average laptops, the performance is more stable, and laptops suffer from major over heating which will slow down your computer immensely and can even destroy your hardware; trust me I learned the hard way.

I once had a gaming laptop that had 3 internal fans and was sitting in a chill mat on max fan speeds and the internal temp still got above 100
And melted the thermal sensors on my GPU and It corrupted my main hard drive, laptops have poor cooling and overheating is no joke.


Anyway best of luck, theres plenty of good options just shop around; I would reccomend seeing if you live nearby a Fry's Electronics store and if so going in and talking to the sales people; they sell computers day in and day out and get all the customer feedback so they know what is and is not worth the money.

I couldn't really suggest, there's lots of options to choose from.  Instead I recommend using our[ recommended specs](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752654-Minimum-and-Recommended-System-Requirements) guide to help find one best fit for you.  I hope that helps!

Okay I'm sorry, everybody in here has been completely useless and has no idea of what they are talking about. I was a poor kid, I've tried league on many things, mostly under 300 dollars. These days I play with low spec shit for fun, so enough with proving my credibility, let's get to the meat. The Acer Swift 1 for $260 on amazon will run league at around 40 frames with some tuning of the graphics settings. Don't expect much else from it though, this thing is only equipped with Intel Pentium N4200 and the shitty included Intel HD Graphics 505. I would say hook up a mouse to this thing and you'll be competitive. Sorry for the late reply.
